cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi ENE of Guantanamo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest through the Bahamas, then forecast to bend northwest and parallel the Southeast U.S. coastline before curving seaward off the North Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (near North Palm Beach–Sebastian Inlet corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Sebastian Inlet FL to Flagler/Volusia county line; Tropical Storm Watch Dominican Republic Puerto Plata westward
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Haiti, parts of eastern Cuba, the Bahamas, and Florida coast from Golden Beach to Sebastian Inlet; Tropical Storm Warning Dominican Republic–Turks & Caicos and South Florida Keys/Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through the Carolinas, including Cape Fear area
weather_observation.wind: Probability of tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) rises to about one-third by late Saturday; 50 kt winds remain low (≤14%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center tracks close to shore, minor to moderate surge of 1–3 ft above ground level is possible along the Cape Fear River mouth and adjacent barrier islands.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could drop 4–8 inches, with localized higher totals, leading to flash-flood potential in the Wilmington metro and port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents and coastal erosion expected ahead of closest approach; possible brief tornadoes in outer rain bands.
